title-part.text: RESISTORS

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, the term "adjustable" means mechanically adjustable.
Variable resistors, the value of which is changed non-mechanically, e.g. by voltage or temperature, are classified in group H01C7/00.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Details
Mounting
Supporting
the base extending along and imparting rigidity or reinforcement to the resistive element

reference.text: H01C1/016 takes precedence; the resistive element being formed in two or more coils or loops as a spiral, helical or toroidal winding H01C3/18, H01C3/20; the resistive element being formed as one or more layers or coatings on a base H01C7/00

wound on cylindrical or prismatic base

Non-adjustable resistors made from powdered conducting material or powdered semi-conducting material with or without insulating material

reference.text: consisting of loose powdered or granular material H01C8/00;

CPC-specific-text.text: measuring deformation in a solid state using the change in resistance formed by printed-circuit technique G01B7/20; insulating materials H01B3/00; passive thin-film or thick-film semiconductor or solid state devices H01L27/00; resistors without a potential-jump or surface barrier specially adapted for integrated circuits, details thereof, multistep manufacturing processes therefor H01L28/20

reference.text: ; resistors with a potential-jump barrier or surface barrier, e.g. field effect resistors H01L29/00; semiconductor devices sensitive to electromagnetic or corpuscular radiation, e.g. photoresistors, H01L31/00; devices using superconductivity H01L39/00; devices using galvanomagnetic or similar magnetic effects, e.g. magnetic-field-controlled resistors, H01L43/00; solid state devices for rectifying, amplifying, oscillating or switching without a potential-jump barrier or surface barrier H01L45/00; bulk negative resistance effect devices H01L47/00;

CPC-specific-text.text: ohmic resistance heating H05B3/00; printed circuits H05K

title-part.text: having positive temperature coefficient

CPC-specific-text.text: formed as one or more layers or coatings
containing oxides or oxidic compounds, e.g. ferrites
Vanadium oxides or oxidic compounds, e.g. VOx
consisting of conducting or semi-conducting material dispersed in a non-conductive organic material

title-part.text: having negative temperature coefficient

note-paragraph.CPC-specific-note: In groups H01C7/043 - H01C7/049, the last place priority rule is applied, i.e. at each hierarchical level, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, classification is made in the last appropriate place.

CPC-specific-text.text: formed as one or more layers or coatings
mainly consisting of inorganic non-metallic substances
Vanadium oxides or oxidic compounds, e.g. VOx
mainly consisting of organic or organo-metal substances

voltage responsive, i.e. varistors

note.note-paragraph: Groups H01C7/02 - H01C7/13 take precedence over groups H01C7/18 - H01C7/22.
